body.p:
Louisville Oct 27 1862
Hon J F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
Sir

At the time of Thomas Stephens arrest he was a Corporal in My Company and one of the most efficient and worthy non Commissioned officers I had -- a good soldier in every respect. Always obeying Orders to the very letter He exerted himself more and had a greater influence in Keeping a good disiplin in the Company than any non Commission officer of the Company He ought to have been a Seargent instead of Corporal

Yours Very Respectfully
W Blood Late Capt Co "B" Louisville Provo Guard
I fully endorse the within in every particular

C C Hare Capt
Co "G" Pro Guard
(Late Lieut Co B)
